questions.question: What is regenerative braking?
options: A type of brake pad material
Converting kinetic energy back into electrical energy during braking
A system that replaces brake fluid
A way to make brakes last forever

questions.question: How does regenerative braking improve EV range?
options: It doesn't affect range at all
It recovers energy that would otherwise be lost as heat
It makes the car lighter
It reduces tire wear only

questions.question: When does regenerative braking work most effectively?
options: Only when the car is parked
During gradual deceleration and coasting
Only at maximum speed
When the battery is fully charged

questions.question: Do EVs still need traditional friction brakes?
options: No, regenerative braking replaces them completely
Yes, for emergency stops and when the battery is full
Only in cold weather
Only for show

questions.question: What happens to the recovered energy from regenerative braking?
options: It is wasted as noise
It is stored back in the battery for later use
It is used to power the air conditioning only
It is released into the atmosphere
